2020 US Presidential Election (Sep.)

Oct 6, 2020

The first Presidential Debate for 2020 US Presidential Election took place on Sep. 29th.

What is the most important issue to you personally in the upcoming election?

Using our open-ened survey system, we have conducted a poll from Sep. 30th to Oct. 2nd. We recruited 881 respondents through Amazon Mechanical Turk 1.


Response patterns

In this poll, we identified three statistically distinct respondents groups 2. Each row in the above table represents an opinion group and each column represents a respondent group. The value in a cell is the fraction (in percentage) of “Likes,” which is normalized within each column. You can find the list of actual opinion texts at the bottom of this post.

The fractions of Economy and Healthcare are high in every respondent group. We found several other topics and categorized them as the opinion groups 3; many of them are related to recent unprecedented events such as COVID-19, wildfire, Black lives matter issues, and death of Ruth Bader Ginsburg. The three respondent groups have different response patterns for these topics.

It is evident that respondent group B is characterized by Support Biden, Never Trump. In contrast, we can hardly conclude that groups A and C are Trump supporters. The fact that the fractions of Support Trump are 5.2% and 2.3% in these groups indicates that this is not their major issue; note that this result does not implies that there are not so many Trump supporters or Joe Biden is in the lead. The population of each respondent group is shown below.

Population of the respondent groups

The acutal opinion texts of each category are listed below. Among 144 independent opinions 4, we only show few of them that earned many “Likes.”

"Kindness"
  • Love and unity
    27 likes
  • Be kind.
    27 likes
  • Kindness, compassion, and decency. I'd like for there to be more important things to the administration than their own power and income.
    23 likes
"Climate change"
  • Taking action on climate change
    67 likes
  • Pass laws that address climate change by reducing the use of fossil fuels and encouraging the use of alternative energy sources
    61 likes
  • Climate Change
    56 likes
"Other responses"
  • eliminating world wide corruption
    90 likes
  • Basic human decency.
    64 likes
  • No new wars, reigning in the riots, removing anti-white and anti-American propaganda from schools ending all COVID lockdowns/stay at home orders, stopping Democrat politicians from imposing open-ended unconstitutional limitations on American citizens.
    45 likes
  • Review and rewrite outdated laws and their process.
    30 likes
  • We have had Democratic presidents and Republican presidents. The country always survives no matter who is in power.
    28 likes
"COVID-19"
  • COVID-19 GOING TO DO THE ALL EFFECTS IN ELECTION. WE NEED TO WAIT AND SEE IT
    110 likes

    98 likes
  • How covid 19 influences job market.
    97 likes
"Support Biden/Never Trump"
  • Having a functional adult in office
    75 likes

    65 likes

    63 likes

    62 likes
"Healthcare"

"Aptitude as the president"

  1. Disclaimer: The results here may not be accurate. Moreover, it is possible that the results presented here may be update in the future. ↩

  2. There is no initially prepared opinions in this poll. ↩

  3. We put annotations on most of the opinions, and utilized them in graph clustering. ↩

  4. We have excluded invalid opinions. ↩
